title: "Takydromus septentrionalis"
output: html_document
---

*Takydromus septentrionalis*, also known as China grass lizard, are found widely across southern China in grassland and shrubs as the name tells.  
They are pretty small and ranges about 5.5 - 7.8 cm (snout-vent length) and prey on insects. Males have larger heads than females.  
This species of lizards are oviparous and give birth to live youngs.  
(Xiang et al., 1996)
